8623 - ``coords``: A list of scalars containing the coordinates that 

8624 the violin's kernel density estimate were evaluated at. 

8625 

8626 - ``vals``: A list of scalars containing the values of the 

8627 kernel density estimate at each of the coordinates given 

8628 in *coords*. 

8629 

8630 - ``mean``: The mean value for this violin's dataset. 

8631 

8632 - ``median``: The median value for this violin's dataset. 

8633 

8634 - ``min``: The minimum value for this violin's dataset. 

8635 

8636 - ``max``: The maximum value for this violin's dataset. 

8637 

8638 Optional keys are: 

8639 

8640 - ``quantiles``: A list of scalars containing the quantile values 

8641 for this violin's dataset. 

8642 

8643 positions : array-like, default: [1, 2, ..., n] 

8644 The positions of the violins; i.e. coordinates on the x-axis for 

8645 vertical violins (or y-axis for horizontal violins). 

8646 

8647 vert : bool, optional 

8648 .. deprecated:: 3.10 

8649 Use *orientation* instead. 

8650 

8651 If this is given during the deprecation period, it overrides 

8652 the *orientation* parameter. 

8653 

8654 If True, plots the violins vertically. 

8655 If False, plots the violins horizontally. 

8656 

8657 orientation : {'vertical', 'horizontal'}, default: 'vertical' 

8658 If 'horizontal', plots the violins horizontally. 

8659 Otherwise, plots the violins vertically. 

8660 

8661 .. versionadded:: 3.10 

8662 

8663 widths : float or array-like, default: 0.5 

8664 The maximum width of each violin in units of the *positions* axis. 

8665 The default is 0.5, which is half available space when using default 

8666 *positions*. 

8667 

8668 showmeans : bool, default: False 

8669 Whether to show the mean with a line. 

8670 

8671 showextrema : bool, default: True 

8672 Whether to show extrema with a line. 

8673 

8674 showmedians : bool, default: False 

8675 Whether to show the median with a line. 

8676 

8677 side : {'both', 'low', 'high'}, default: 'both' 

8678 'both' plots standard violins. 'low'/'high' only 

8679 plots the side below/above the positions value. 

8680 

8681 Returns 

8682 ------- 

8683 dict 

8684 A dictionary mapping each component of the violinplot to a 

8685 list of the corresponding collection instances created. The 

8686 dictionary has the following keys: 

8687 

8688 - ``bodies``: A list of the `~.collections.PolyCollection` 

8689 instances containing the filled area of each violin. 

8690 

8691 - ``cmeans``: A `~.collections.LineCollection` instance that marks 

8692 the mean values of each of the violin's distribution. 

8693 

8694 - ``cmins``: A `~.collections.LineCollection` instance that marks 

8695 the bottom of each violin's distribution. 

8696 

8697 - ``cmaxes``: A `~.collections.LineCollection` instance that marks 

8698 the top of each violin's distribution. 

8699 

8700 - ``cbars``: A `~.collections.LineCollection` instance that marks 

8701 the centers of each violin's distribution. 

8702 

8703 - ``cmedians``: A `~.collections.LineCollection` instance that 

8704 marks the median values of each of the violin's distribution. 

8705 

8706 - ``cquantiles``: A `~.collections.LineCollection` instance created 

8707 to identify the quantiles values of each of the violin's 

8708 distribution. 

8709 

8710 See Also 

8711 -------- 

8712 violinplot : 

8713 Draw a violin plot from data instead of pre-computed statistics. 

8714 """ 

8715 

8716 # Statistical quantities to be plotted on the violins 

8717 means = [] 

8718 mins = [] 

8719 maxes = [] 

8720 medians = [] 

8721 quantiles = [] 

8722 

8723 qlens = [] # Number of quantiles in each dataset. 

8724 

8725 artists = {} # Collections to be returned 

8726 

8727 N = len(vpstats) 

8728 datashape_message = ("List of violinplot statistics and `{0}` " 

8729 "values must have the same length") 

8730 

8731 # vert and orientation parameters are linked until vert's 

8732 # deprecation period expires. If both are selected, 

8733 # vert takes precedence. 

8734 if vert is not None: 

8735 _api.warn_deprecated( 

8736 "3.11", 

8737 name="vert: bool", 

8738 alternative="orientation: {'vertical', 'horizontal'}", 

8739 pending=True, 

8740 ) 

8741 orientation = 'vertical' if vert else 'horizontal' 

8742 _api.check_in_list(['horizontal', 'vertical'], orientation=orientation) 

8743 

8744 # Validate positions 

8745 if positions is None: 

8746 positions = range(1, N + 1) 

8747 elif len(positions) != N: 

8748 raise ValueError(datashape_message.format("positions")) 

8749 

8750 # Validate widths 

8751 if np.isscalar(widths): 

8752 widths = [widths] * N 

8753 elif len(widths) != N: 

8754 raise ValueError(datashape_message.format("widths")) 

8755 

8756 # Validate side 

8757 _api.check_in_list(["both", "low", "high"], side=side) 

8758 

8759 # Calculate ranges for statistics lines (shape (2, N)). 

8760 line_ends = [[-0.25 if side in ['both', 'low'] else 0], 

8761 [0.25 if side in ['both', 'high'] else 0]] \ 

8762 * np.array(widths) + positions 

8763 

8764 # Colors. 

8765 if mpl.rcParams['_internal.classic_mode']: 

8766 fillcolor = 'y' 

8767 linecolor = 'r' 

8768 else: 

8769 fillcolor = linecolor = self._get_lines.get_next_color() 

8770 

8771 # Check whether we are rendering vertically or horizontally 

8772 if orientation == 'vertical': 

8773 fill = self.fill_betweenx 

8774 if side in ['low', 'high']: 

8775 perp_lines = functools.partial(self.hlines, colors=linecolor, 

8776 capstyle='projecting') 

8777 par_lines = functools.partial(self.vlines, colors=linecolor, 

8778 capstyle='projecting') 

8779 else: 

8780 perp_lines = functools.partial(self.hlines, colors=linecolor) 

8781 par_lines = functools.partial(self.vlines, colors=linecolor) 

8782 else: 

8783 fill = self.fill_between 

8784 if side in ['low', 'high']: 

8785 perp_lines = functools.partial(self.vlines, colors=linecolor, 

8786 capstyle='projecting') 

8787 par_lines = functools.partial(self.hlines, colors=linecolor, 

8788 capstyle='projecting') 

8789 else: 

8790 perp_lines = functools.partial(self.vlines, colors=linecolor) 

8791 par_lines = functools.partial(self.hlines, colors=linecolor) 

8792 

8793 # Render violins 

8794 bodies = [] 

8795 for stats, pos, width in zip(vpstats, positions, widths): 

8796 # The 0.5 factor reflects the fact that we plot from v-p to v+p. 

8797 vals = np.array(stats['vals']) 

8798 vals = 0.5 * width * vals / vals.max() 

8799 bodies += [fill(stats['coords'], 

8800 -vals + pos if side in ['both', 'low'] else pos, 

8801 vals + pos if side in ['both', 'high'] else pos, 

8802 facecolor=fillcolor, alpha=0.3)] 

8803 means.append(stats['mean']) 

8804 mins.append(stats['min']) 

8805 maxes.append(stats['max']) 

8806 medians.append(stats['median']) 

8807 q = stats.get('quantiles') # a list of floats, or None 

8808 if q is None: 

8809 q = [] 

8810 quantiles.extend(q) 

8811 qlens.append(len(q)) 

8812 artists['bodies'] = bodies 

8813 

8814 if showmeans: # Render means 

8815 artists['cmeans'] = perp_lines(means, *line_ends) 

8816 if showextrema: # Render extrema 

8817 artists['cmaxes'] = perp_lines(maxes, *line_ends) 

8818 artists['cmins'] = perp_lines(mins, *line_ends) 

8819 artists['cbars'] = par_lines(positions, mins, maxes) 

8820 if showmedians: # Render medians 

8821 artists['cmedians'] = perp_lines(medians, *line_ends) 

8822 if quantiles: # Render quantiles: each width is repeated qlen times. 

8823 artists['cquantiles'] = perp_lines( 

8824 quantiles, *np.repeat(line_ends, qlens, axis=1)) 

8825 

8826 return artists 

8827 

8828 # Methods that are entirely implemented in other modules. 

8829 

8830 table = _make_axes_method(mtable.table) 

8831 

8832 # args can be either Y or y1, y2, ... and all should be replaced 

8833 stackplot = _preprocess_data()(_make_axes_method(mstack.stackplot)) 

8834 

8835 streamplot = _preprocess_data( 

8836 replace_names=["x", "y", "u", "v", "start_points"])( 

8837 _make_axes_method(mstream.streamplot)) 

8838 

8839 tricontour = _make_axes_method(mtri.tricontour) 

8840 tricontourf = _make_axes_method(mtri.tricontourf) 

8841 tripcolor = _make_axes_method(mtri.tripcolor) 

8842 triplot = _make_axes_method(mtri.triplot) 

8843 

8844 def _get_aspect_ratio(self): 

8845 """ 

8846 Convenience method to calculate the aspect ratio of the Axes in 

8847 the display coordinate system. 

8848 """ 

8849 figure_size = self.get_figure().get_size_inches() 

8850 ll, ur = self.get_position() * figure_size 

8851 width, height = ur - ll 

8852 return height / (width * self.get_data_ratio())
